title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a treasured recipe passed down through generations. With its flaky crust and luscious, nutty filling, this pie is perfect for celebrations or cozy gatherings that call for a sweet, comforting treat.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in the chilled, diced butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix the egg yolk with ice water and stir into the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out the dough and place it in a 9-inch pie plate.
Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Add eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract; blend well.
Pour the filling over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the pie is golden brown and the filling is set.
Allow the pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling firm up.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water to ensure a flaky crust. Avoid overmixing the dough to keep it tender. Watch the pie closely during the last 10 minutes of baking to prevent overbrowning. Let the pie cool fully for the perfect slice.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie is a timeless dessert that delights with its buttery crust and rich, gooey filling studded with crunchy pecans. The aroma of toasted nuts and vanilla fills the kitchen as it bakes, promising a slice of Southern hospitality in every bite.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Classic Southern dessert with authentic flavors
  • Perfect balance of sweet, nutty, and buttery textures
  • Ideal for holiday gatherings, family dinners, and special occasions
  • Uses simple pantry staples and fresh pecans
  • Impresses guests with its beautiful golden crust and glossy filling

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion, and its rich, comforting flavors instantly brought back memories of Southern hospitality and warm gatherings. Sharing it with loved ones makes every occasion feel extra special.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide a satisfying crunch and authentic Southern flavor; toast lightly for extra depth.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract enhances the sweetness and adds warmth; choose pure vanilla for best results.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter for a flaky crust and rich filling, corn syrup for that classic glossy texture, and eggs to bind everything together.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pastry cutter or fork, rolling pin, 9-inch pie plate, and an oven thermometer for precise baking.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in chilled butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk mixed with ice water to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and ensure flakiness.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and fit into pie plate. Layer pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake first at high heat to set crust, then reduce temperature to cook filling until golden and set.
Finishing Touches:
Cool pie completely on a wire rack to allow filling to firm up before slicing. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream for extra indulgence.

upload.context: Beautiful finished dish with vibrant colors and appetizing presentation

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Preheat oven fully and use an oven thermometer for accurate temperature.
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent a dry filling or burnt crust.
  • The filling should be set but slightly jiggly in the center when done.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerated for up to 4 days; reheat gently.

structured_content.content: This pie always brings back fond memories of sharing sweet moments with family during holidays. Its comforting flavors and beautiful presentation make it a centerpiece that everyone looks forward to.

Enhance the pie by adding a splash of bourbon or a pinch of cinnamon to the filling for warmth and complexity. Toast the pecans lightly before adding to deepen their nutty flavor. For a richer crust, substitute half the butter with browned butter.

Serve warm or at room temperature with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of dessert wine for a perfect finish. Ideal for festive dinners, potlucks, or cozy weekend treats.

For a gluten-free version, use a gluten-free flour blend for the crust. Vegan adaptations can replace butter with coconut oil and eggs with flax eggs, though texture will vary. Try adding chocolate chips or swapping pecans for walnuts for a unique twist.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Keep butter and water cold to achieve a flaky crust.
  • Mix filling ingredients gently to avoid incorporating too much air, which can cause cracking.
  • Start baking at high heat to set crust, then lower temperature to cook filling evenly.
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a glossy, golden finish.

structured_content.content: With this Southern Pecan Pie recipe in your repertoire, you can confidently create a dessert that delights both the eyes and palate. Enjoy the process and savor the sweet rewards of homemade baking!
